sections.heading: What is Negative Imperative?
sections.content:
Negative imperative expresses prohibition - "Don't do!" It's even stronger and ruder than positive imperative.

食べるな！(taberu na!) - Don't eat! 行くな！(iku na!) - Don't go! するな！(suru na!) - Don't do it!

Warning: Very strong! Use with extreme caution!

sections.heading: How to Form Negative Imperative
sections.content:
Simple rule: Dictionary form + な

食べる + な → 食べるな (Don't eat!) 行く + な → 行くな (Don't go!) する + な → するな (Don't do!)

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content: 食べる → 食べるな (Don't eat!) 見る → 見るな (Don't look!) 寝る → 寝るな (Don't sleep!) 起きる → 起きるな (Don't wake up!) 教える → 教えるな (Don't teach!)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content: 書く → 書くな (Don't write!) 読む → 読むな (Don't read!) 話す → 話すな (Don't speak!) 買う → 買うな (Don't buy!) 待つ → 待つな (Don't wait!) 遊ぶ → 遊ぶな (Don't play!) 帰る → 帰るな (Don't go home!) 泳ぐ → 泳ぐな (Don't swim!) 行く → 行くな (Don't go!)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → するな (Don't do it!) 来る → 来るな (Don't come!)

sections.heading: Complete Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | Negative Imperative | Meaning | | ---------- | ------------------- | ------------ | | 書く | 書くな | Don't write! | | 読む | 読むな | Don't read! | | 話す | 話すな | Don't speak! | | 買う | 買うな | Don't buy! | | 食べる | 食べるな | Don't eat! | | 見る | 見るな | Don't look! | | する | するな | Don't do! | | 来る | 来るな | Don't come! |

children.heading: 1. Emergency/Danger
children.content: 触るな！ "Don't touch!" 動くな！ "Don't move!" 見るな！ "Don't look!"

children.heading: 2. Strong Warning
children.content: 危ない！行くな！ "Dangerous! Don't go!" それを食べるな！ "Don't eat that!"

children.heading: 3. Signs/Written Warnings
children.content: 入るな "Do not enter" 触るな "Do not touch" 駐車するな "Do not park"

children.heading: 4. Very Casual Male Speech
children.content: 心配するな "Don't worry" 気にするな "Don't mind it" 諦めるな "Don't give up"

sections.heading: Polite Alternatives
sections.content:
DON'T use ～な in polite situations!

Use these instead:

children.heading: ～ないでください (Please don't)
children.content: 食べないでください "Please don't eat" (polite) 触らないでください "Please don't touch" (polite)

children.heading: ～てはいけません (Must not)
children.content: ここで遊んではいけません "You must not play here" (polite prohibition) 写真を撮ってはいけません "You must not take photos"

children.heading: ～ないで (Casual request)
children.content: 行かないで "Don't go" (casual but not rude) 泣かないで "Don't cry" (gentle)

children.heading: Warnings
children.content: 危ない！触るな！ "Dangerous! Don't touch!" 止まれ！動くな！ "Stop! Don't move!" 逃げるな！ "Don't run away!"

children.heading: Prohibitions
children.content: 入るな "Don't enter" 近づくな "Don't come close" 見るな "Don't look" 言うな "Don't say it"

children.heading: Encouragement (Negative)
children.content: 諦めるな！ "Don't give up!" 負けるな！ "Don't lose!" 心配するな "Don't worry" 泣くな "Don't cry"

sections.heading: Signs and Written Warnings
sections.content: 駐車するな "No parking" 立入禁止 / 入るな "No entry" ゴミを捨てるな "Don't litter" 触るな "Do not touch" 撮影するな "No photography"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using in Polite Situations
children.content: Wrong: 触るな (to stranger) ❌ Right: 触らないでください ✓ "Please don't touch" Wrong: 行くな (to superior) ❌ Right: 行かないでください ✓ "Please don't go"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using Nai-form + な
children.content: Wrong: 食べないな ❌ Right: 食べるな ✓ "Don't eat" (Use dictionary form + な, not nai-form!)

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using with Polite People
children.content: Wrong: 先生、見るな！ ❌ Right: 先生、見ないでください ✓ "Teacher, please don't look" NEVER use with superiors!

sections.heading: Softening Negative Imperative
sections.content:
Add particles to make less harsh:

行くなよ "Don't go" (softer, advice) 泣くなよ "Don't cry" (encouraging) 心配するなって "Don't worry, I said"

sections.heading: Politeness Levels
sections.content: | Form | Strength | Usage | | -------------------------- | ----------- | ----------------- | | 食べるな | Very strong | Emergency/rough | | 食べないで | Casual | Friends | | 食べないでください | Polite | Normal requests | | 食べてはいけません | Formal | Rules/regulations | | お食べにならないでください | Very polite | Honorific |

children.heading: Male Speech
children.content:
More likely to use negative imperative:

来るな！ "Don't come!" やるな！ "Don't do it!"

children.heading: Female Speech
children.content:
Rarely uses negative imperative:

来ないで "Don't come" (te-form) やらないで "Don't do it" (te-form)

children.heading: Example 1: Emergency
children.content: A: あ！危ない！ "Ah! Dangerous!" B: 触るな！ "Don't touch!" A: え？ "Huh?" B: それ、熱いから "That's hot"

children.heading: Example 2: Warning
children.content: A: ちょっと見てくる "I'll go take a look" B: 行くな！危ないぞ "Don't go! It's dangerous" A: 大丈夫だって "It's fine" B: 本当にやめろ "Really, stop"

children.heading: Example 3: Encouragement
children.content: A: もうだめだ... "I can't do it anymore..." B: 諦めるな！頑張れ！ "Don't give up! Do your best!" A: でも... "But..." B: 最後まで負けるな！ "Don't lose until the end!"

sections.heading: Imperative vs Negative Imperative
sections.content:
| Positive | Negative | Meaning | | -------- | -------- | ----------------- | | 食べろ | 食べるな | Eat / Don't eat | | 行け | 行くな | Go / Don't go | | しろ | するな | Do / Don't do | | 来い | 来るな | Come / Don't come |

Both are very strong!

children.heading: やめろ vs するな
children.content: やめろ！ "Stop (what you're doing)!" するな！ "Don't do it!" Similar but slightly different nuance.

children.heading: 心配するな
children.content: 心配するな "Don't worry" (common phrase) 大丈夫だから、心配するな "It's okay, so don't worry"

children.heading: 負けるな
children.content: 負けるな！ "Don't lose!" / "Don't give up!" (Common encouragement in sports)

sections.heading: In Anime/Manga
sections.content:
Very common in dramatic scenes:

やめろ！ "Stop it!" 行くな！ "Don't go!" 死ぬな！ "Don't die!" 諦めるな！ "Don't give up!"

Note: This is dramatic language!

sections.heading: Combining with Other Elements
sections.content: 絶対に諦めるな！ "Never give up!" もう二度と来るな "Don't ever come again" そんなこと言うな "Don't say such things"

sections.heading: When NOT to Use
sections.content:
Avoid in:

Normal conversation With strangers With superiors Formal situations Customer service First meetings Professional settings Polite company

Use instead:

～ないでください (polite) ～てはいけません (formal prohibition) ～ないで (casual request)

children.heading: Encouragement
children.content:
諦めるな！ "Don't give up!" 負けるな！ "Don't lose!" 泣くな "Don't cry"

These are actually encouraging, despite being imperative!

children.heading: Self-talk
children.content: 忘れるな "Don't forget" (to oneself) 油断するな "Don't let your guard down" (to oneself)

sections.heading: Practice Recognition
sections.content: 食べるな - Negative imperative "Don't eat!" 食べないで - Casual request "Don't eat" 食べないでください - Polite "Please don't eat" 食べてはいけません - Formal "You must not eat"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Negative imperative = dictionary form + な ✓ Very strong prohibition ✓ Even ruder than positive imperative ✓ Common in emergencies and warnings ✓ Used on signs and warnings ✓ More common in male speech ✓ Use ～ないでください in polite situations ✓ Never use with superiors ✓ Can express encouragement (諦めるな)

Related:

Imperative Form Te-form Nai-form Verb Groups
